definition: to cover/to encase/cover/sheath/to overlap/to interleave/to model after/to copy/formula/harness/loop of rope/(fig.) to fish for/to obtain slyly/classifier for sets, collections/bend (of a river or mountain range, in place names)/tau (Greek letter Ττ)

sentences.english: They wear galoshes in wet weather.
sentences.chinese: 他们在下雨天穿胶套鞋。

sentences.english: Those are put in the galosh on the balcony, the majority made a patch.
sentences.chinese: 那些放在阳台上的套鞋，绝大部分是打了补丁的。

sentences.english: Myself presently am the cape Kang full overshoe valuable Weifang general agent.
sentences.chinese: 本人现为海角康足套鞋宝潍坊总代理。

sentences.english: She removed her overshoes at the front door.
That old maid-in-waiting immediately put ons the overshoe ses with the speed that same chase in the behind.
sentences.chinese: 那个老宫女立刻穿上套鞋，以同样的速度在后面追赶。

sentences.english: He was wearing galoshes and an absurd hat.
sentences.chinese: 他穿著橡胶套鞋和戴著一顶可笑的帽子。

sentences.english: An article of footwear worn over a shoe as protection from water, snow, or cold.
sentences.chinese: 保护鞋子不受水或雪破坏的一种防水套鞋。

sentences.english: My rubbers are here in the hall closet, but the umbrella's disappeared.
sentences.chinese: 我的套鞋在客厅的壁橱里，但雨伞不见了。

sentences.english: You'd better wear rubbers, for it's raining.
sentences.chinese: 天在下雨，你最好穿上“橡胶”套鞋。

sentences.english: One of Ramona's galoshes was lying on the landing.
sentences.chinese: 瑞摩娜的一只套鞋正躺在落脚处。

definition: flip-flops/abbr. for 人字拖鞋[ren2 zi4 tuo1 xie2]
quilted cotton trousers/cotton-padded trousers (worn in winter)
